dkeep.logic

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • dkeep.logic.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Game.java - class that manages the game, keeps record of levels, saves and reads data from files
    Author:
    Leonardo Capozzi, Ricardo Carvalho

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Game()
      Constructor used to play the default game levels saved in level1.map and keep.map
      Game(Map m2, Hero h2, Guard g2)
      Constructor used to create a new dungeon type game, only for saving purposes.
      Game(Map m2, Hero h2, Ogre[] o2)
      Constructor used to create a new keep type game, only for saving and testing an edited level.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Guard getGuard()
      Gets the guard in the current level
      Hero getHero()
      Gets the current hero state in the current level
      Map getMap()
      Gets the current map state in the current level
      Ogre[] getOgre()
      Gets the ogres in the current level
      int losscheck()
      Checks the loss conditions for a dungeon type level (if hero and guard are in adjacent cells)
      int losscheckkeep()
      Checks the loss conditions for a keep type level (if hero with basher is in cell adjacent to an ogre's bat or hero without basher is either adjacent to an ogre or its bat)
      int nextLevel(int[] info)
      Sets the next level checking the game state (if next level doesn't exist considers game beaten)
      void OgreMove()
      Sets in motion the ogres' movement, erasing current position, setting a new position and checking proximity to a hero's basher (if there is any) recurring to auxiliary functions
      void SaveLevelFile(java.lang.String levelName)
      Saves the whole level's information in a .map file to play later
      void setStunned()
      Sets the ogre's stunned status (ogre is stunned if it's in a cell adjacent to hero with basher)
      int wincheck()
      Checks if level is won

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(Map m2,
            Hero h2,
            Guard g2)
        Constructor used to create a new dungeon type game, only for saving purposes.
        Parameters:
        m2 - map information to save for latter use
        h2 - hero status to save in a file
        g2 - guard status to write in a file

      • Game

        public Game(Map m2,
            Hero h2,
            Ogre[] o2)
        Constructor used to create a new keep type game, only for saving and testing an edited level.
        Parameters:
        m2 - map information to save for latter use
        h2 - hero status to save in a file
        g2 - guard status to write in a file

      • Game

        public Game()
        Constructor used to play the default game levels saved in level1.map and keep.map

    • Method Detail

      • nextLevel

        public int nextLevel(int[] info)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Sets the next level checking the game state (if next level doesn't exist considers game beaten)
        Parameters:
        info - array that includes information as guard personality (at index 0) and number of ogres (at index 1)
        Returns:
        int to indicate game state, returns 0 case game is won and 1 otherwise
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getGuard

        public Guard getGuard()
        Gets the guard in the current level
        Returns:
        Guard object or null if current level is of keep type

      • getHero

        public Hero getHero()
        Gets the current hero state in the current level
        Returns:
        Hero object

      • getMap

        public Map getMap()
        Gets the current map state in the current level
        Returns:
        Map object

      • getOgre

        public Ogre[] getOgre()
        Gets the ogres in the current level
        Returns:
        An array of Ogre object or null if current level is of dungeon type

      • wincheck

        public int wincheck()
        Checks if level is won
        Returns:
        1 if level is won and 0 otherwise

      • losscheck

        public int losscheck()
        Checks the loss conditions for a dungeon type level (if hero and guard are in adjacent cells)
        Returns:
        1 if level is lost and 0 otherwise

      • losscheckkeep

        public int losscheckkeep()
        Checks the loss conditions for a keep type level (if hero with basher is in cell adjacent to an ogre's bat or hero without basher is either adjacent to an ogre or its bat)
        Returns:
        1 if level is lost and 0 otherwise

      • OgreMove

        public void OgreMove()
        Sets in motion the ogres' movement, erasing current position, setting a new position and checking proximity to a hero's basher (if there is any) recurring to auxiliary functions

      • setStunned

        public void setStunned()
        Sets the ogre's stunned status (ogre is stunned if it's in a cell adjacent to hero with basher)

      • SaveLevelFile

        public void SaveLevelFile(java.lang.String levelName)
        Saves the whole level's information in a .map file to play later
        Parameters:
        levelName - the name of the level that we want to save, previously checked to avoid replacing an existing file
